  • Method Details

    • approxEquals

      public static final boolean approxEquals(double a, double b, double epsilon) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Detects whether two values are within a certain range of each other.
      Parameters:
      a - the first value
      b - the second value
      epsilon - the range
      Returns:
      whether they are approximately equal according to the range
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if epsilon is negative

    • lerp

      public static final double lerp(double a, double b, double f)
      Lerps two values by the given factor. Replacement for MathUtil.interpolate(double, double, double) that does not restrict the multiplier to [0, 1]. Example: having values 4 and 7 and a factor of 1.33 gives 8, and having values 10 and 20 with a factor of 0.65 gives 16.5.
      Parameters:
      a - the first value
      b - the second value
      f - the multiplier of the difference
      Returns:
      the result of the lerp

    • clamp

      @Deprecated public static final double clamp(double val, double min, double max) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Deprecated.
      use MathUtil.clamp(double, double, double)
      Clamps a number between two values.
      Parameters:
      val - the value to clamp
      min - the minimum allowed value
      max - the maximum allowed value
      Returns:
      the clamped value
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if max is less than min

    • map

      public static final double map(double val, double in_min, double in_max, double out_min, double out_max)
      Maps a value from one range to another. Note: min and maxes can be swapped for easy flipping over a range.
      Parameters:
      val - the value to map
      in_min - the initial range's minimum
      in_max - the initial range's maximum
      out_min - the output range's minimum
      out_max - the output range's maximum
      Returns:
      the mapped value

    • quadratic

      public static double quadratic(double x, double a, double b, double c)
      Helper function for quadratic equations: ax^2 + bx + c

    • logarithm

      public static double logarithm(double x, double a, double b, double c)
      Helper function for logarithmic equations: a * log(x - c) + b
